intro: Cyphia cardamines, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Cyphia cardamines has a short growing season and is often found at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for alpine ecosystems.
